meanings.definition: A piece of armor for the leg below the knee.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore sturdy greaves to protect his legs in battle.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers in ancient times often used greaves to shield their lower legs.
meanings.sent3: The greaves looked like shiny tubes on the knight's legs, making him resemble a walking metal statue.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her greave, shielding her from the harsh criticisms of others.
meanings.sent5: The greaves clanked loudly as the knight marched, announcing his presence on the battlefield.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would greave the armor before sending it off to the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: It was important to greave the soldiers properly before they headed into battle.
meanings.sent3: The young squire learned how to greave the knights' armor with precision and care.
meanings.sent4: She would greave the leg plates with intricate designs, adding a touch of elegance to the armor.
meanings.sent5: The armorers worked tirelessly to greave each set of armor, ensuring the soldiers were well-protected.

meanings.sent1: The brave warrior greaved his legs before facing the dragon in combat.
meanings.sent2: She always made sure to greave her shins before engaging in any dangerous activities.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight forgot to greave his legs and ended up with bruises after the jousting match.
meanings.sent4: His unwavering faith in himself acted as a shield, greaving him against self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The magical greaves enchanted by the wizard provided unparalleled protection to the wearer.
